document.discussion_title: Badminton Day 2 preview: Shu goes for win in men’s singles | WWLP.com
document.topic_text: Click to share on Pinterest (Opens in new window) While Howard Shu looks to get a win vs. Indonesia’s Tommy Sugiarto on Friday morning in the men’s singles tournament, Sattawat Pongnairat and Phillip Chew will play their second game of men’s doubles against V Shem Goh and Kiong Wee Tan of Malaysia on Court 3 Friday morning. Additionally, Chew will play with Jamie Subandhi for the second time tomorrow afternoon vs. Japan’s Kenta Kazuno and Ayane Kurihara in mixed doubles action. That match will be on Court 3. Iris Wang, USA’s women’s singles player, plays tomorrow night vs. Telma Santos of Portugal on Court 1. Eva Lee and Paula Lynn Obanana also play tomorrow for the U.S. in the women’s doubles tournament. They take on Denmark’s Christinna Pedersen and Kamilla Rytter Juhl on Court 2. Other notable matchups to watch for tomorrow: Men’s singles: Lin Dan (CHN) vs. Vladimir Malkov (RUS) Jan O Jorgensen (#5 world ranking) vs. Raul Must (Estonia) Mixed doubles: Gabrielle and Chris Adcock (GBR) vs. Joachim Fischer Nielsen/Christinna Pedersen (DEN)
